results.title: Flowers on a one way street
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Yorkville Avenue, Toronto, received newspaper prominence after it became what the papers called a “hippie haven”. This film records what happened after the young people staged demonstrations to have the street closed to traffic, and civic authorities used corresponding persuasions to keep it open as a necessary traffic artery. The main confrontation takes place at a council meeting in City Hall, to which spokesmen for the young people have come to present their case. Here the film provides opportunity to judge both their attitudes and those of the city administration. Music by The Beatles and Ravi Shankar. Photography by Douglas Kiefer and edited Christopher Cordeaux. (Awards: Chicago; New York).

results.title: Flowers at work
results.brief_description: Animation and time lapse cinematography show the physiology of flowers, various types of flowers, and their methods of pollination. The part played by insects in the process of cross-fertilisation is illustrated, and the structure and function of the sepals, petals, stamens, pistil, anthers, pollen grains, stle, and ovaries are studied. The film also shows some examples of how cultivation has modified the form of some flowers.

results.title: The Flowering city of London
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The film traces the history of open spaces in the City of London from the Middle Ages to the present day, when gardens and open spaces are slowly being won back for the community. Shows the work of the Corporation of London and the Metropolitan Public Gardens Association. Written by John and Mary Daniels.

results.title: The Flower
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Canadian Cancer Society and Westminster Films
results.brief_description: Tells of the historic discovery in 1959 of a drug called VLB (Vincaleukoblastine), which is still one of the most effective means of fighting Hodgkin’s disease, or cancer of the lymph glands.

results.title: The Flow of electricity
results.brief_description: Explains the factors which affect the flow of electricity through a simple electrical circuit, introduces the electron theory, and shows the application of a simple circuit in a home situation. The film is centred around the inquiries of two children whose father explains to them what electricity is, how it flows through a closed circuit, what the function of the switch is, and how electricity used in the home travels over an electrical circuit.

results.title: Floor management
results.creator_credit: Peter Combes and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Demonstrates techniques of floor management in television production, showing application to an actual rehearsal. Bob Holness interviews Colin Dudley, a floor manager of considerable experience.

results.title: On solder
results.brief_description: Presents the latest soldering techniques used in the electronics industry. Uses close-up photography to reveal the physical and chemical actions that occur in soldering. Shows the difference between perfect and imperfect solder points and demonstrates the detrimental effect of a poor joint on the efficiency of the electronic circuit.

results.title: The Flinders: ranges of legend
results.creator_credit: G Shepherd and S A Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: The geological origin and the place of the Flinders Range in Aboriginal mythology. Shows rock paintings and carvings in the Wilpena area, the old mining town of Blinman and the ruins of Kanyaka.

results.title: Flight: a new awareness
results.brief_description: As young people fly with hang gliders and a pilot soars upwards in a glider plane, the pilot reflects on how despite the earth’s many wonders - humans have always envied the birds and longed to fly. Soaring higher and higher, the pilot experiences an exhilarating freedom and a whole new perspective of the earth below. The earth becomes a single, living organism - more beautiful than he ever imagined. He discovers how fragile a hold life has on this planet and dreams of a technology that refines and perfects, rather than destroys and pollutes.

results.title: Flight plan
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The organisation of ciial aviation in Australia; the planning and control behind, and during, every flight; the training of pilots and maintenance staff; plans for the future development of the service. Also features the Royal Flying Doctor Service.
